trustfund:

            RESPONSE IN NORTHERN IRAQ,TF092237-IRTF - IRAQ REGIONAL HEALTH

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Regional Health
            Emergency Response Project for Iraq were as follows: overall
            outcome was moderately satisfactory, the risk to development
            outcome was substantial, and both the Bank and the Borrower
            performance were moderately satisfactory. The important
            project lessons learned were: (1) in uncertain,
            post-conflict and low capacity environments keep the project
            simple and focused on the main development outcome. (2)
            Proactive supervision and hands-on support are paramount for
            success in low capacity environments. (3) In conflict or
            post-conflict projects, flexibility in adjusting project
            content during implementation is advisable. (4) Planning and
            investing for sustainability should be embedded in the
            project design. (5) Training and capacity building are
            mandatory but not enough for acquiring specialized technical
            expertise. (6) Dedicated expertise is still needed after
            project completion to ensure sustainability. (7) Solid
            technical knowledge and skills and management expertise are
            a sine qua non in the selection process of the
            implementation agencies for successful project preparation
            and implementation.
